question: hey, hey, hey... if you two are happy, then i'm happy for you.  i'm fine!

question: absolutely.  i'm fine! totally fine. i don't know why it's coming out all loud and squeaky, 'cause really,  i'm fine. i'm not saying i wasn't a little surprised to see you guys kissing. i mean, at first i was like..  but now that i've had time to absorb it; lovin' this.
answer: ross..

question: it's all working out! me & charlie, and you two. you know what we should do?
answer: calm ourselves?

question: no. we should all have dinner. yes, we'll do it tomorrow night. i'll cook!!

question: god, this adoption stuff is so overwhelming. there's inter-country adoption, dependency adoption.. there are so many ways to go, and this is like the biggest decision of our lives.
answer: there's a hair in my coffee.

question: hey guys!
answer: hey.

question: hey, have you seen frank jr., 'cause he's meeting me here with the triplets.
answer: you know, it's funny. every time you say "triplets," i immediately think of three hot blonde 19-year olds.

question: that's sweet. drink your hair.
answer: hey, what's all this stuff?

question: oh, they're brochures from different adoption agencies.
answer: ooh, babies! oh, this one is so cute, get this one!

question: that's not really how it works.
answer: oh, how does it work?

question: i don't know!
answer: well, if you're having a hard time, you should talk to my friends, bill and colleen. they adopted a kid. i'm sure they'd help you.

question: that's not what we talked about!!
answer: hey!

question: hey.
answer: good to see you.

question: good to see you, too.
answer: hi frank.

question: hi, how you doin'?

question: which one is which again?
answer: oh, that's frank jr. jr. pulling the tampons out of the lady's purse. and that's chandler climbing on chandler, and that's leslie throwing bagels at him. monica : "willing to adopt triplets?" no!

question: ah, can i just say i know we're doing this for ross, and that's cool, but if it was up to me, this is not what we'd be doing on our first date.

question: i'd take you out for a romantic night. some champagne, fancy dinner, feel you up on the carriage ride home...

question: hey, charlie!
answer: hey.

question: hi, hi. so.. dreading this?

question: so, did you bring a little something for ross?

question: oh. oh, thanks.
answer: and you know, you can just give me my stuff whenever you want.

question: uh, actually, that's..
answer: underwear, a toothbrush, and van halen cd. i can use all these things!!

question: gosh, ross, you know, you seem a little...

question: oh, god. so adorable. look at them sleeping there like angels.

question: well, they may be a handful, but they're so cute.
answer: yeah.

question: oh, god, the last time i babysat them, they did the funniest thing..
answer: i haven't slept in four years!

question: that's a, that's a long time.
answer: you just don't know how hard it is, phoebe. there's just so many of them. you know, two i can handle. two's great. you just hold one in each hand, but what do i do when the third one runs at me with his bike helmet on. i've got no more hands to protect my area! there's three of them, phoebe, three!

question: yeah, i know, frank. i counted them when they were coming out of my area.
answer: sometimes i think that.. oh, no, no, no, i can't say it, it's too horrible. no.

question: what?
answer: no, i can't.

question: oh my god, frank, are you thinking of leaving? because i didn't have those triplets so you could just run out on them!
answer: oh, no! i would never do that. no. i just was thinking that, you know, maybe you could take one.

question: thank you so much for seeing us. phoebe has told us such great things about you guys.
answer: oh, please, we're happy to help.

question: we went through the same thing when we were adopting.
answer: so, a lot of malfunctioning wee-wees and hoo-hoos in this room, huh?

question: i mean, you have a lovely home.
answer: well, we appreciate anything you can tell us.

question: it's pretty much all the information you need.
answer: oh my god!

question: everything is broken down into categories, and then cross-referenced, and then colour-coded to correspond with the forms in the back.
answer: thank you.  i think i just had a tiny orgasm.

question: i know the process is frustrating, but it's so worth it. adopting owen was the best thing that ever happened to us.
answer: that's great.  can i see the book?

question: you want me to wash my hands first, don't you?
answer: it's.. it's just so pretty and white.

question: i would have told him to do it too.
answer: can i adopt you?

question: hey, you must be owen.
answer: yeah.

question: yeah, in fact my father was a den-mother.

question: you know how to use a compass?
answer: i have a badge in it.

question: you do? that's fantastic!

question: i'd love to, but i gotta get back to talking to your parents. they're telling us all about how they adopted you.

question: what?
answer: i'm adopted?

question: the first batch of margaritas was not so great, but the second batch is gooooood.

question: oh, guys, this is fun, isn't it? you know? just the four of us. just hangin'.

question: i'm fine! hey, i'm great! i'm just.. i'm just proud of us. there's no weirdness, no tension.

question: look, charlie, i just want you to know. ross is just having a little trouble adjusting to the thought of joey and me. you know, he normally doesn't drink like this.

question: fajitas! be careful, very hot plate, very hot plate!!

question: okay, well, this is crazy. can't seriously be talking about me taking one of your kids, can we?

question: insane.
answer: i know.

question: alice would never go for it, right?
answer: oh, i don't know, she's pretty tired, too, i think we've got her onboard.

question: well, just you know, for argument's sake, you know, hypothetically. which one would you be willing to give up?
answer: huh.

question: frank jr.jr.?

question: uh-huh.

question: well, alright, that's fine. what about leslie?

question: alright, so that leaves chandler.

question: wow, frank. i think we just ran out of kids.

question: we have to leave!!

question: hey.

question: and to love. ah, love. l-o-v-e, love. l is for life. and what is life without love?
